intro: Bolanthus spergulifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, often in disturbed soils. It has a fibrous root system and produces pods that contain several seeds. Bolanthus spergulifolius is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
